website_summaries.verdict: The best budget car health monitor that does away with a expensive screen.
pros: Car monitor connects directly to any OBD2 port in most modern cars
Connects with a specialized Android or iOS app to show stats from a smartphone
cons: Connection with the app can be limited or slow at times

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent!!! Works well with my IPhone & my sons Android. Have used it with Carly & CarDr for my BMW, Torque for my sons Mustang & my wife's GMC. Other apps as well, can't remember them all. But it has connected to every app we have tried on both iPhone & android, whether code readers or performance apps. I highly recommend for the price. This is WIFI and not Bluetooth so sometimes it can take an extra step or two to set up, but always works, eventually.🙂
customer_reviews.author: Allen Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Nice... when it works
customer_reviews.text: This Foseal scan tool is a huge disappointment. It works when it wants too. It disconnects repeatedly, and then finally stops responding. After an hour it usually works when plugged in again. Would not recommend. 9/7/18 I drilled out the melted pins on the device and discovered a possible reason for its loss of connection. The top board was loose from the main chip. Some sealant to hold it in place, and voila, it works. Good because I needed to clear a code.
customer_reviews.author: NebraskaDude

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it, I kept having some signal drop offs. From time to time it would take 2-3 seconds to refresh the value. I was thinking to return it, but tried it again. This time I used it to monitor fuel pressure during 1 hr commute. It worked fine. It would refresh about every .2 s and it never dropped for longer than this. I suspect that interference with other 2.4 ghz signals around the house had something to do. Attached are some screen shots from OBDCarDoctor. Over all device is definitely worth $20. Itsso much better to be able to use app on your phone than regular OBD reader.
customer_reviews.author: Scoobiemario

customer_reviews.title: Worked once when I first got it. Tried 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked once when I first got it. Tried 4 different phones cant get it to work for anything. Foseal pestered me for the review. Wasnt going to complain but they insisted. So... Rubbish product save your cash buy someone elses.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, but I wish I would have purchased the Bluetooth one. When you connect to it via WiFi on your phone, you no longer have internet connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lufrano

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt return error code.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't return the error code on either my car or my friends pickup. In both cases it returned no error and cleared the error. Checked with my Machanic and there is definitely a problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Beal

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Save Money
customer_reviews.text: Why spend $50-100 for a diagnostic test when you can spend just $20 and use an app to see what's wrong with your car? The Scan Tool is incredibly easy to use - just plug it in and use an app on your phone to read the code. This is especially useful if you're like me and prefer to fix easy stuff yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not do as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works for basic code reading, but to use all of the advertised capabilities, you need to purchase a $10 app for EACH vehicle you want to use it on. Yep... your car $10, your girlfriends car $10, your mom's car $10. Completely ridiculous that it is $10 for each vehicle. Seller is unresponsive to questions.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: this product is awesome. i do not need to leave my house to work on my altima coupe. i chose to use DashCommand for android. this device is great at reading error codes and diagnostics. it is also great and reading active/live readings. the device will get pretty warm after driving with it still plugged in. my only complaint is that when my cell phone is connected to the device through wifi, my phone thinks that it has internet and therefore i have no internet service during the usage of this device with my sony xperia x compact.
customer_reviews.author: momo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Device for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device! I downloaded the free app but I purchased the OBDCarDoctor app for more complete functionality. I tried it on 4 of my family's cars to get a baseline. If any issues crop up I will attach and identify the problem for my brother-in-law the mechanic. Very easy to set up its own network between the smartphone and device. I would recommend this to anyone, especially those who wish to ensure they are getting competent service prior to bringing their vehicle into a garage for work...or for DIY-ers.
customer_reviews.author: TightMan

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This product was a true plug and play for my vehicle. I used OBD Fusion App from iTunes and paired with my (iOS) iPhone 6S. It quickly started running through the diagnostics and immediately provided me with up to second data on my vehicle. No lag time either. Heard a lot of frustrating reviews about OBD devices not pairing correctly. This was not the case for me. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M

customer_reviews.title: Ugh, overhyped product
customer_reviews.text: It's not so much the dongle, but getting software to talk to it. They don't bundle any software, so you need to go and find something suitable that maybe might work. One of the included program links- DashCommand, is no longer supported by the manufacturer. And figuring out which App works with this thing, is like pulling teeth. Oh, and would be too much to ask for an instruction sheet that is big enough to read? The tiny one supplied, is nearly impossible to read (and i'm nearsighted). Even a link to a pdf file would be a nice thing to have. So, far, its been a frustrating experience getting this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Nathe

customer_reviews.title: Okay product!
customer_reviews.text: The wifi was working fine the first day! Then as time went on about after a week the wifi became very slow, I mean like extremely slow! Every time my phone connects to it, it buffers for a long time I get frustrated and then just turn off the wifi! How can I get it to work faster???
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Can’t use navigation on phone with this running
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind that you can’t use navigation on your phone if this is connected. My iPhone assumes that any connected WiFi device is a internet device so it prevents data over cellular if any WiFi device is connected. I wish it would use cellular data if the WiFi device isn’t connected to the internet but it doesn’t. Not the fault of the OBD 2 device’s manufacturer, though.
customer_reviews.author: Flibberhibbit

customer_reviews.title: Think twice
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was the result of an impulse buy and one of my first purchases on amazon. I still regret it to this day. If you want an OBD tool, just buy the actual handheld tool. Trying to find a free app that supports this model was nearly impossible and even then the apps were rarely accurate. The wifi connection is painfully slow to connect to the phone and I often have to remove and reinsert the module to get it to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Saved Me $$$
customer_reviews.text: Love this! This nifty little gadget is well worth it's price if you are someone who takes your car in for service when a diagnostic light comes on. My Nephew talked me into buying one of these after my 2012 SUV's check engine light came on and this saved me a very expensive trip to the shop for a $9 gasket that he was able to order and install in literally 5 minutes for me. This connects to your vehicle's computer via wifi and will give you the code and description for the warning light so that you know exactly what the problem is BEFORE you take your vehicle in for service.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Made me a Believer
customer_reviews.text: After reading a lot of other reviews I decided to purchase this and everything works better than what people say. There is a free app that you can download that will show everything from temperature to RPMs and more. There might be more in the app you can purchase but the free one does the job for me. You can clear engine lights see when it was last cleared and it will tell you a little bit about the issue and more. Works with my iPhone and connects via Wi-Fi. This product is also fairly simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: C. N. Charkowski

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me at all. I tried on my android and my friend's iphone it worked on neither device.
customer_reviews.author: Ming Chi

customer_reviews.title: Easy plug n play.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Plugnplay. Fast shipping. Bigger than I thought, but it's still hidden under the dash out of the way so... its size is ok for me. Recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: TheBaldEagle

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be a bluetooth device.
customer_reviews.text: Really a hindering that this is not a Bluetooth device. It shut down all my other apps when in use such as spotify. I also did not like the app that was recommended. It was no easy to understand and I had to pay extra for the app to understand any of the engine light warnings. Very disappointed. One star for the great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: shopcur

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: My first OBD car system scanner I have ever owned. This is really cool devices easy to set up I was able to understand and operate the device without any issues. However In one of the recommended apps it does cost $10 to be able to use it to its fullest ability. Other than that I absolutely love this car Monitor and because that $10 does not reflect this product in particular and the app is not theirs I don't consider it a fault of this device at all. In short it's fun to use Easy to research the codes on Google or use the apps and had a great experience with it.
customer_reviews.author: Garth D.

customer_reviews.title: Works on 2000 Nissan Xterra SE, 2008 Nissan Armada SE, 2004 Toyota Tacoma.
customer_reviews.text: Got Service Engine Soon light steady on. Tried the method without a scanner. Saw this for $20 here. Arrived on time, works great. Looking forward getting some insight on the vehicles. Always something than needs doing. This allowed me to figure out what was up (codes: P0325 knock sensor, P1444 EVAP valve) with the Xterra, ordered some parts and waiting for install/replacement.
customer_reviews.author: rariti

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Wifi doesn't connect well. Says it performs all OBD2 functionality, but does not work with BMW MHD tuning app. Also downloaded several other apps and really struggled with it. At one point it disconnected while i was clearing a code and my car's computer freaked out and threw almost every error possible. I thought I fried my DME. Luckily I was able to get BMW coding software with a real cable and salvage it. The bluetooth version works better, but still isn't great.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S. Yarmo

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if it's me or the scanner, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's not doing what it's supposed to do. I went with the recommendations on the box for blue tooth apps. Not happening. I'll keep trying. It could be something I'm not doing or something as simple as a weak signal. We'll see. UPDATE 12/02/18: Seller reached out to me and agreed to take the scanner back. Kudos to him for keeping his customers interests in mind. Have added another star for his honesty and integrity.
customer_reviews.author: where's waldo

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my Japanese vehicles
customer_reviews.text: I have a '14 Nissan Leaf and '12 Mazda 3 and it works good in both vehicles. I'm able to read the codes on both vehicles and use LeafSpy on the Leaf to keep track of the battery. Though because it is fairly big I wouldn't want to leave it in the Leaf as I would knock it out of the port getting in and out of the vehicle. If it was half the length it wouldn't be an issue. I've had two of these for about a year now and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: gregom

customer_reviews.title: Scan Tool with WiFi interface does not work well with androids. Buy scan Tool with bluetooth interface
customer_reviews.text: I had to return as it did not work with my Google Pixel smartphone via WiFi. In fact, to use Scan Tool with Android smartphone you have to buy the device with bluetooth interface. Here is a device from the same company that I have purchased for my Google Pixel - Foseal Car Scanner OBD Bluetooth Adapter Car Diagnostic Scanner Code Reader - it costs less and it works fine!
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Nikonov

customer_reviews.title: Works well, take a little time to learn how to use app.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well - connection was not a problem. I am bummed that it really didn’t help me with my issue, but its not a fault of the device. Apparently my TPMS error messages are not sent through this. I’m trying to diagnose which TPMS sensor is going bad.
customer_reviews.author: bmansc

customer_reviews.title: Works with iPhone 5SE,IOS app, 2007 Honda,1997 Lincoln 1998 Volvo V70!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 10/2018 for the Lincoln C.E.L. and helped because I didn't have to keep going back to the auto parts store to get the readings and reset to codes. I bought the 1998 Volvo V70 in California and it needed a smog and this little device with an IOS app (Car Scanner Pro) helped me get the emissions passed without having to keeping checking the 10-12 items that had to be cleared before I got it smoged. Once all the green checks came on I took it to get it smoged without issues. Works for me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Serna

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but has super bright LEDs that are distracting. Easy fix with tape over the lights, but enough work to lose a star.
customer_reviews.text: It works well with my 2011Mazda3. I use DashCommand with my iphone, and torque with my android and it connects well. Only trouble is those LED lights. Holy moly, they are a driving hazard with how bright they are. I put some tape over them so they are dimmer and still useful. Another thought to consider is that needing to connect with wifi means you can't use your phone's data, so if you aren't using a secondary device for monitoring, get a bluetooth version.
customer_reviews.author: Arin Chakraverty

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job, and was very accurate for 2 different issues I had.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: This worked on my 2012 Ram truck and told me it was a cylinder 2 misfire. That helped the mechanic narrow down the issue of a bad cam shaft that was causing the misfire. (AKA, it was spot on!!) It worked again in my Wife's 2013 Dodge Durango when it was having issues. Told us the error code, and told us the edc sensor (or something) was the route of the problem. Again, the mechanic knew right where to go from there, and it was correct again. Handy little sucker to have around!! Worked on my 2012 Ram 1500. Clear the check engine light and a few other issues.
customer_reviews.author: t morgan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, even with the free OBD Car Doctor app ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, even with the free OBD Car Doctor app on my iphone! Amazing technology for next to nothing! I couldn't read any codes in my 2012 Audi A4 with my 10 year old code reader I paid $60 for, this read my codes and could reset them in seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Drake

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Does not connect to my iPhone 6 on my 2012 Honda Crosstour. When I emailed tech support all I got was the instructions that came with it. I can read and follow instructions, so the support was worthless in my opinion. Not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Use to be good
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these one stopped working ordered another and get the same error they won’t connect to my phone or iPad. Tried multiple phones in my house and same issue. Unable to connect to network total junk now maybe an iOS update blocked it no clue...returning and trying bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: pike513

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: This item works well, so far. I use it with all my iOS devices. I chose to use it with the OBD Fusion app. To connect to this unit, plug it into your vehicle’s OBD II port, then you go into “Settings” on your iOS device, under “WiFi”. Connect to it just like you would connect to your home WiFi network, then open the app on your iOS device and it’s pretty self-explanatory from there. With the OBD Fusion app, I can diagnose any trouble codes, reset them, also read many other values related to a vehicle’s performance. Much cheaper than going to the dealer every time a “Service Engine” light comes on.
customer_reviews.author: Billz

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool. Found this while researching for a much ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great tool. Found this while researching for a much more expensive standard reader and am glad I chose this one. With the FREE ODB Car Doctor App. for IPhone, I was able to pull up my trouble codes, diagnose the issue, make the repair and then clear the code on my 02 Sport Trac. I then loaned it to my son who downloaded the FREE Torque Lite app for android and he used it to troubleshoot and repair his 99 Jeep Grand Cherokee. The seller even contacted me to ensure that I was satisfied! I highly recommend this product from this seller. Go ahead and give it a try. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: John R. Whalen

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this tool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the scan tool to clear the check engine light on my 2004 Infiniti g35. I had cleaned and reoiled my air filter and oil got on the MAF causing the check engine soon light to appear. After cleaning the MAF the light remained on so I purchased the scan tool. I had to purchase a month of Auto Doctor software in order to clear the code which it did. I also had another trouble code which caused the car to miss on a rare occasion. Since clearing both codes the car runs perfectly with no misses. I recommend this tool
customer_reviews.author: Davo68

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner , very useful
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner, very useful. Used it to diagnose an overheating problem with the cooling fan circuit. Cleared not only stored trouble codes but also powertrain pending codes after I fixed the problem. So far I have 3 cars profile stored in it and I purchased the enhanced features to delve deeper into trouble shooting for each car, definitely worth the money. I use OBD FUSION program from the App Store, don’t go cheap, well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy Fierro

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the shade tree mechanic.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent way to see what is going on in your auto computer without breaking the bank. More functions than I will ever use. I used my iphone, with the app it works great. Reads codes, clears codes, displays diagnostic data.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Guest

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money or time on this one
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2002 Lexus SC 430 and it doesn’t work for it. I tested it on my 2015 Nissan and it worked but it’s advertised to work for my Lexus.. unfortunately I missed the return window becuz I was sick with flu. Don’t waste your money or time on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Gianni

customer_reviews.title: No Longer Works
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought this device last year it worked but not all the time. I purchased the OBD Fusion app and sometimes it would not connect. Well now it's a few months later and I cannot get it to work at all. I've tried multiple apps, multiple cars, and multiple phones. Considering that they do not make their own app and guarantee that it works, I would stay away.
customer_reviews.author: John O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Great OBDII for finding Check Engine Light problems.
customer_reviews.text: Great OBDII scan tool has already found a couple of problems on different cars that made it possible for me to fix. One specific was a misfire on cylinder 1. Upon careful examination of cylinder 1 spark plug coil pack a crack was discovered, Replacing the spark plug coil pack solved the error and fixed the car running roughly. Since it creates its own WIFI you can use this anywhere with your cell phone after downloading anyone of a number of different apps. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stardust

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time and worked with ease. Finding the correct app required I use a QR scanner (found in the Apple wallet on iPhone if you don’t want to download one). It connected perfectly once I had the correct app. The interface for the app is not what is shown in the pictures (for iPhone, no gauge illustrations, just number read outs). That said, it does exactly what it says it will do, which is read codes and clear them. For the money, you can’t beat this.
customer_reviews.author: JBled85

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast and performed as expected. Once you get the app to read the scanner you can monitor all kinds of information real time. Used to trouble shoot a check engine light and was able to solve problem.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Picked up instantly as a wifi hotspot. Cons: Wifi interface means you have to disconnect from home internet. Each time you disconnect from the Scan tool it has to be physically removed from car and plugged back in to be able to connect to it again. Other Notes: The software recommended by the instructions is not very good in its free version, full functions are available if purchase the full version for $10... Software I used: ScanMaster Lite (for ELM327) from android play store
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and good
customer_reviews.text: I love this Little device. It's super cheap and seems to work with almost any vehicle. I have tested it with a Honda, BMW, Nissan, and Volkswagen. I have iOS and use dash commander to link up with the device. The only negative is that the ODB ports on all of the vehicles seem to have continuous power even without the key in the ignition. So if this device is plugged in, it will slowly consumed battery power until it's all gone
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this. All the reviews were so good that ...
customer_reviews.text: Won’t work without WIFI Our WiFi doesn’t work outside. Tried troubleshooting without success. I really wanted to like this. All the reviews were so good that I did not expect it to be a waste of money. Perhaps the model of car, phone and WiFi all have to be a perfect combo to work...?
customer_reviews.author: L B

customer_reviews.title: App only worked once.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware worked fine alone. Bought basic app version for $25 in addition to the hardware, worked ONE time then never again. Will not connect; hard to follow steps to connect anyway, 0 support. For $25 yes I expect it to work with a phone. All together $50 wasted and a big headache.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Didn't connect, tried 4 different apps
customer_reviews.text: Didn't connect. Tried 4 different apps. Apps would should protocols being tried, which matched the ones listed for the unit. Didn't work. Returning day 1.
customer_reviews.author: iPad user

customer_reviews.title: Great product, little issue on the first connection
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it did take a while to figure out how to get the wifi-connected to this device I would suggest to anybody reading this that you should disable your phone's data, because that's the issue I had said the Wi-Fi connection on this device is not internet my phone had an issue with it until I disable the data on my phone
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Anthony Loftus

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with FORD Powerstrokes - Shuts Engine Off.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose shouldn't really "review" it because it doesn't work with my truck. If you're looking for a reader that works with a Ford Powerstroke diesel then you should keep looking. This reader will connect and give some information but then will shut the engine off and give a "Service Engine Soon" light and there's no warning so if you attempt to drive and look at the information you will stall in traffic and have no idea why. Rather dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor H

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while but now dead
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this product has such high ratings, makes me wonder if there are numerous false reviews for this product. It stopped working for me. It worked a few times and transmit data but now it will not connect. Tried updating everything to get it to connect, but it does not connect. It goes to the attempts to connect but does not connect. Very frustrating fortunately it is within the 30 days so I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are some pretty slick dashboards on the app
customer_reviews.text: This OBDII does everything as advertised. With the $10 app, I can see every sensor in real time displayed on my cell phone. I am using it as a temperature gauge - way cheaper than replacing the instrument cluster or installing an after market unit. I can leave it run continuous or call it up as needed. There are some pretty slick dashboards on the app, and numerous functions not available on my vehicle, like: Hp, torque, instantaneous mpg, injection position, etc.... BUY IT, I'm getting another for my other vehicle. I leave it plugged into the OBDII outlet on the car all the time.
customer_reviews.author: gnac

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Can't connect to phone
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. I downloaded a couple different apps on my Android phone to try using this. None of them could connect to the device Edit: this was a 1 star review. Bumped it up to four stars because their customer service was pretty good. They responded to my post about this failure, sent me instructions to try out. When it still didn't work they concluded I must have gotten a faulty device and refunded my purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: ZR

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Fits!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a couple OBD II port scanners in the past, and this exceeds expectation. Mainly because of dual iOS and Android functionality, this does more than what the standard OBD scanner can do. It is a little larger than some, but provided your car's OBD port doesn't stick out too much, it should be fine. Paired with the right software, and it's a powerful tool for your car. OBD II Scan Tool + Works well and has LED lights + Functional with iOS AND Android + Compatible with multiple apps and software + Wifi connection - Larger than some slim OBD adapters - Not bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Clueless to car fixed in a jiffy!
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with my car's idle going from normal to really rough about 20 minutes after I filled the gas. I wasn't sure what the problem was. I have 2 small children, and I cannot waste $$ or time. I ordered this product and got it the same day. Even with the minor (user) error (I tried to find the device on bluetooth instead of Wifi) within 15 minutes I knew what the problem was. The #3 cylinder was miss-firing. I was able to change the spark plugs that evening. I love how easy this device is to use!
customer_reviews.author: AJaye

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive tool
customer_reviews.text: Once you download the recommended app it works fine. I have used this on 2 of my vehicles, and it gives me way more information than I require. I just want to know why my engine light is on, but there is a lot of info for mechanics and skilled techs to use if they need it. I use it with my iPhone, but assume it works okay with Androids also. Once I get the repair codes I look them up on the internet to figure what repairs are needed.
customer_reviews.author: W King

customer_reviews.title: Works good, but you need to buy a separate app
customer_reviews.text: Worked good, immediately connected to my Ford OBD. In order to use you need to pick an app on the Google or Apple store and connect it to the device via WiFi. In order to use all features you have to pay ~$9.00 for the expanded app. Other then that. I had no issues and it communicated perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great fault reader
customer_reviews.text: This thing, together with a compatible (free) app for your phone, lets you see any codes, messages, warning etc. for your car. Saves me inconvenient trips to the dealer only to find it's a 'service required' message or a fault because the gas cap isn't tight. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: P. Heald

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Fyi... the app is free. You have to pay $20 to do any of the features on the app. And... no, it’s not a one time fee. You pay $20 a year to use the app. Should have just bought a wired version and saver myself the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great value - try with free app first
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. My 1997 BMW doesn't support all the features, but I was able to see why "check engine" was on. I was also able to reset it for now, and we shall see what happens. Next I will examine my 2002 Tahoe and a 2011 RAV4. Seems to be well worth the money. I'm using the free app so far, but this thing was such a bargain I'm considering tossing another $10 to get one of the better apps.
customer_reviews.author: Craig G Laurer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Add to My Toolbox
customer_reviews.text: I like knowing what's going on with my car. I'm not a mechanic, but this will help me learn to do a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work and instructions are terrible
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to fully communicate with my 2013 Ford Fusion. Could read codes, but not as easily as described and would not clear them. Instructions are self contradictory and the recommended you-tube videos were of little help. Emailed seller for advice on getting it to communicate better with my car and received instructions that were clearly contradictory to what was in the printed instructions.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself many times over just using it once!
customer_reviews.text: TBH; I envied my mechanic's ~$85 OBD2 reader simply because of how much faster a wired one can connect. -His can't be used as a speedometer, or read all the other sensors output in real time in the car like this can though. ps; I believe there's a newer version out for 19.99.
customer_reviews.author: matt benedict

customer_reviews.title: Great product but I didn't like that it was always ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product but I didn't like that it was always powered on with OBD. In my Jeep the OBD always receives power so this device would always be running, emitting a wifi signal, and draining battery. I cut into it and soldered a wire into power and rerouted it to a fuse tap that was powered via ignition. Also broke off the pin that took power from OBD. Other than that, works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! The app is free, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! The app is free, but you can (I did not) pay $10 to keep a log and track your vehicle's performance and tests over time. Works perfectly with the free app, it showed me in plain English (no codes) why my check engine light was on; then I simply cleared it with one click. Voila, check engine light is gone!
customer_reviews.author: Amar Gandhi

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a really great product. It's easy to connect to and works perfectly with the dash command app. Much better than the old obd-ii cord I was using with my laptop. I love being able to use my iPhone to monitor and diagnose my vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Blu0val

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have tried it with all my vehicles. I think that I should have gotten the Bluetooth version since it hogs the WiFi connection and I think it would useful to look up information on the INTERNET while looking at the OBD II data. I have tried both Windows software and iPhone Apps and it works well with both.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for clearing faults
customer_reviews.text: Once i found right software this thing rocks! Excellent for clearing faults! Thank you Foseal for your great tech support and product! Great gift for Dads!
customer_reviews.author: Chris L Madsen

customer_reviews.title: After installing it in my BMW 328i 2007 the car ...
customer_reviews.text: After installing it in my BMW 328i 2007 the car started to generate some problems. While I was driving, suddenly the engine was turned off, the steering became very rigid, so I had to park the car. A warning sign linked to the brake system came out on the control panel. I decided to remove the equipment and the computer returned to work properly. I'm going to return this OBD II
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I ordered it with same day shipping ($9.99) and I received the product sometime around evening. My car was due for oil replacement and was running on a low engine oil and my check engine light showed up. When I plugged OBD2, i saw P0455 which was a result of low engine oil. I saved the diagnostics and cleared the code as I had already replaced the oil. When i asked the dealership, they had told me it would cost me $130 to diagnose. I am totally convinced with this product that did the magic under $20/-.
customer_reviews.author: Chandru

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely refused to open an OBD2 connection with an LG ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely refused to open an OBD2 connection with an LG G3 running Android 5.0, and an LG V20 running Android 7.0. Can't find a single guide for fixing this issue, as it seems trying to find the WiFi tool will show me results for the Bluetooth tool instead.
customer_reviews.author: Gibson Holder

customer_reviews.title: Extremely convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Wife's car threw a Check Engine Light. Plugged this thing in, turned the car on, connected my iPhone to the wireless signal it was emitting, then opened DashCommand. It connected automatically, and I found the error code quick as that. It was nothing to worry about. Now my wife isn't afraid to drive the car and repairs can wait. All this convenience and knowledge for $20 and change!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive replacement for error code meters and real time data from your car.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Read and turn off error codes. Tells you any information that is sensed in your car. Real time reading of radiator temperature, manifold intake temperature, and more . This and a smart phone or tablet replaces an expensive meter . This can stay in place in your car to check any data at and time. Very low price for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: m005kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Honestly one of my best purchases. Obviously it’s not a good as a shops scan tool. But it will at least give you a heads up when your check engine light comes on and can give somewhere to start if something is wrong. I like using it on road trips to monitor my real time temps in my engine. Used on my Nissan 350z, GMC Sierra, and Mitsubishi Lancer.
customer_reviews.author: VondruZ Racing

customer_reviews.title: User friendly interface.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a more expensive obd 2 scanner that was stolen from my jeep with this model. Not only is it very inexpensive it performs all the functions I require to troubleshoot problems with my 2000 Jeep Wrangler. The free software version works flawlessly on my Samsung s4 mini. Very happy with the product and would recommend it to friends and family menbers.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works everywhere except on Mercedes (because Benz sucks)
customer_reviews.text: Works great, Buick, Corvette, Kia, Ford. Except on the wife's Mercedes. The Mercedes guy says that I have to but a $200 brand for someone including the special Mercedes software. Pricks. I thought the law said that every car had to have an OBD2 interface? Maybe the law doesn't say that it actually has to work.
customer_reviews.author: Arch Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Really like the scanner
customer_reviews.text: Really like the scanner. I would recommend purchasing the Dashboard app to get the full use of this great tool. Only thing I don't like is that if you are driving with it on and it's connected to wifi you really can't use your phone for anything else. Such as if someone is with you and wants to use the interweb, gps in searching for a hotel on the road you have to disconnect and turn your wifi off to use other functions on the phone. Also it would be nice to interface the scanner information via wifi to a computer program. Other than that I love the scanner. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Works every time, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on a 2016 Honda Odyssey, multiple years of Honda Accord, and Toyota Camry. The code reader worked every time. I bought a $10 app called Dash Commander that shows every gauge and sensor that returns readings. I use it when checking out used cars to see what might be hidden.
customer_reviews.author: tj

customer_reviews.title: IF you buy two, you might get one that works.
customer_reviews.text: When you purchase cheap chinese things, always order at least two - then you may have a fighting chance of getting one that works. I'll also note that this site tries to change my one-star rating to 3 - which is inaacurate. A solid one. When this worked (once) it did what I needed, but plugged in a second time results in nothing, just a red light, no attempt to start. The other one worked just fine and does so to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sliced Bread!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this unit as an inexpensive way to pull error codes from my car. Coupled with a $6 iOS App, works like a champ. I'm sure the free apps work as well, but I like to support the app developers when their apps get great reviews. Unit works great, so much so I plan to order a second unit to keep in my other car, just in case. I definitely would recommend (and have) this to anyone looking for an inexpensive OBD II code scanner.
customer_reviews.author: SXGuinto

customer_reviews.title: It connects via WIFI. I missed that when I ...
customer_reviews.text: It connects via WIFI. I missed that when I ordered it. I should have ordered a bluetooth one. WIFI is okay for connection, but then when you want to look up something on the internet (like the problem you are decoding), you have to disconnect from the OBD and reconnect to the internet. It's a pain not to be able to do both at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: hsteinbe

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough for anyone to use
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly simple and easy to use. The fits into the OBD2 port seamlessly and connection is easy. Product produces it's own wifi and is connected to using phone or tablet. There are multiple apps available for download. Realtime data for multiple readings. I purchased to read codes and to help clear them. 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SeaBass

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected on my 2002 volvo, no problems. Fast update mode works well. You will need an OBDII app on your phone (i suggest Torque for android users) Haven't been able to connect to my 2017 Ford, but it isn't what I bought the device for and I haven't tried very hard. Will update if that ends up working with that vehicle or not.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn W.

customer_reviews.title: Simple inexpensive solution!
customer_reviews.text: Using this with my iPad mini and the AutoMeter Dash Link app. I used this on my 2008 Crown Vic Interceptor, 2005 Interceptor, and my 2002 Excursion. Worked perfect in all of these. I am using the Dash Link app and this scan tool as my gauge cluster until I can afford the Dakota Digital OBDii gauge set for my 57 F100/08 Crown Vic swap. Simple inexpensive solution!
customer_reviews.author: Keri and Dan

customer_reviews.title: ... yet to get this working - it is NOT easy to figure out the apps on the phone to ...
customer_reviews.text: The product fits in the car perfectly however I am yet to get this working - it is NOT easy to figure out the apps on the phone to run the scan. It's not the OBD 2, it's the apps that are tricky.
customer_reviews.author: viola rock

customer_reviews.title: Compatible with IPhone 7+/ 13 Ram 2500 Laramie Longhorn/mega cab
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this morning. Paid $9.99 extra for same day delivery. Received package around 7pm! Great shipping! Very impressed Went straight out to my Truck 2013 Ram 2500 6.7 Cummins Turbo Diesel and set up adapter with my IPhone 7 Plus with app I had already downloaded OBD Cardoctor (free) and synced up the two and was able to check for DTC’s and also erase them! Great product for the price can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Bp2019

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with free apps for Toy Highlander & GMC Sierra 3500
customer_reviews.text: It's worked fine with free apps for my iPhone for a 2008 Highlander and 2006 GMC Sierra 3500. The free apps aren't great, but I've got a couple loaded that seem to do most of what I need. I don't know if it's the apps, or this tool, but I can't get the Maintenance light to go off now on the Highlander. My wife says it's to make you go in for the 75,000 mile service.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Highly, highly, highly, recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give 10 stars. I bought this because I have a brake/stop lamp correlation code in my 06 Kia Sedona that causes the cruise to stop working. I need my cruise for a road trip that I'm currently on, & whenever my cruise does not activate, I open the DashCommand app I purchased to use with this product & just clear the codes which lets my cruise work for 100's of miles! Product can be left in & accessed when needed. Highly, highly recommend this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anita Levijoki

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: The more I use this the more I like it. It displays a lot of information about the engine that I as a DIY'r will never use. The OBD recommended is great! It showed a problem with the ignition coil. P0351 Saved me an expensive car repair charge! The only thing I haven't got it to do is clear the DTC. So I disconnected the battery cable.
customer_reviews.author: C.W. F.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!! Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner with information that was helpful and really easy to use. Setup was easy with the recommended app on my iPhone. Easy to connect and start reading those fault codes and other information. Glad I bought this and I will use it on all my personal vehicles and friends as well if they need it. Who doesn't love a well made and well priced tool/toy!
customer_reviews.author: Zebra Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine. Strange thing was, my truck was lid up with "Check Engine" light, as soon as I plug this in, it gave me an error code I need to look up. As soon after I unplug it, the "Check Engine" light went away.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly to Get Ready for Smog Testing
customer_reviews.text: Worked easily to read codes and clear them. I needed to get my 2003 Sienna smogged but the check engine light was on. I used this tool to clear the fault codes, then drove the car for about a week, and used the tool to check when the readiness codes were ready. I then took the car in and it passed the smog test. Probably saved $900.00 in repairs for evaporative emissions problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Ettinghoff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I use it with the free software download. I have used it with my tablet and a smart phone. For the price I would recommend this to other people.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing, no need to spend big money to find out what’s wrong with your car. Very easy to use, just download an app on your phone and you can see all the trouble codes, delete trouble codes and see several parameters while your car is running. Highly recommend, great for car guys or diy people
customer_reviews.author: Tyler newsome

customer_reviews.title: Good Item. I use it everytime my engine light ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Item. I use it everytime my engine light panel goes on. It saves me time and money because Im able to spot the engine problem and sometimes I fix it myself as long as it's something simple. Otherwise I go to the mechanic to fix it for me but They cant fool me and can't robbed me money because I know the issue too thanks to this scan tool. Thanks guys
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All smiles
customer_reviews.text: Diagnosed the problem, replaced a relay, cleared the codes and am smiling as I drive. The GM dealer wanted $99 just to hook up his diagnostic tool.
customer_reviews.author: hokielovin

customer_reviews.title: Requires additional purchases but still a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy having this around the house but beware that you need a mobile app for this and the Android options are not great/require you to pay an addition $10. It does what you need to for diagnosing your car but just let it be known that there is still more to buy if on Android! (Applie is fine)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing. Works great and makes quick diagnosis easy. I've used it on my car and on a few friend's cars as well. Quick/simple sync to my iPhone SE and gives plenty of useful information for trouble shooting. Everyone should have one handy in the glovebox or whatever so you know how severe a check engine light is immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This took a really long time to connect the first time. I didn't think it was going to work. Have patience and just leave it until it connects. After the first connection it connects very quickly. It does require the purchase of a $10 App. It definitely saves money on the first needed use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny...Worked like a charm and paid for itself 10 times over with my first use!
customer_reviews.text: Saved me 200.00! My sons used it on my wife's Honda Accord and dia. a O2 sensor in short order, easy to replace the $90.00 sensor and it would have costed a bare minimum of $250.00 to have it replaced. We did it for $12 dianostic wi-fi ODBII Foseal tool and a $90 dollar sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

product_meta.title: Car WIFI OBD 2 OBD2 OBDII Scan Tool Foseal Scanner Adapter Check Engine Light Diagnostic Tool for iOS & Android
product_meta.description: Multi-Protocol Support: ISO9141-2(5 baud init,10.4Kbaud) ISO14230-4 KWP(5 baud init,10.4 Kbaud) ISO14230-4 KWP(fast init,10.4 Kbaud) ISO15765-4 CAN(11bit ID,500 Kbaud) ISO15765-4 CAN(29bit ID,500 Kbaud) ISO15765-4 CAN(11bit ID,250 Kbaud) ISO15765-4 CAN(29bit ID,250 Kbaud) SAE J1939 CAN(29bit ID,250*Kbaud) USER1 CAN(11*bit ID,125*Kbaud) USER2 CAN(11*bit ID,50*kbaud) Functions: 1.Read diagnostic trouble codes, both generic and manufacturer-specific, and display their meaning (over 3000 generic code definitions in the database advance timing lights). 2.Clear trouble codes and turn off the MIL ('Check Engine' light) 3.Display current sensor data 4.Engine RPM 5.Coolant Temperature 6.Calculated Load Value 7.Vehicle Speed 8.Fuel System Status 9.Short Term Fuel Trim 10.Long Term Fuel Trim 11.Intake Manifold Pressure 12. Timing advance Compatible App: -Support free "OBD Car Doctor " App for iOS system, you can download it from Apple store, "DashCommand" App for iOS system is $9.9. -Support free "DashCommand" , "Torque Pro" App for Android device. Note: -Please turn on your car when connecting, or the App cannot connect successfully. -Doesn't work with 1995 Ford Ranger, 2000 Sarum, 2000 Honda Civic, 2001 Altima, 2002 Dodge Neon, 2002 Acura, 2003 GMC, 2003 Ford,2005 Toyota Vitz, Renault clio 2005
feature_bullets: Are you the kind of person that likes to make the repairs by yourself? This OBD2 scanner will help you troubleshoot engine codes, saves you a ton of money in diagnostic fees. Diagnose Check Engine Light & Fix the Problem Yourself.

View Current Sensor Data. You will be able to monitor data include Engine RPM, Horse Power, Calculated Load Value, Coolant Temperature, Fuel System Status, Intake Manifold Pressure, Air Flow Rate, Intake Air Temperature, O2 sensor voltages, etc
Support iOS & Android. Recommend “OBD Car Doctor” and "OBD Fusion" ($9.9) for iOS. Recommend "Torque lite"/”Torque Pro” and "DashCommand" for Android. Please wait wifi connection done in 10 seconds
Compatible Makers. Support Chrysler Ford Honda Mazda Toyota VW GM Dodge BMW Chevrolet Audi Subaru KIA Benz & More OBDII Cars. Super Mini OBD2 OBDII Wireless Auto Check Car Diagnostic Scanner
One Year Guarantee. We believe customer service is the basic makes business continue. Any issue with our product, please feel free to contact us, your satisfaction is our total goal!
